intro: Microlicia cipoana, commonly known as the Cipoan microlicia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth. Microlicia cipoana is often found growing on tree trunks or in rocky areas, showcasing its adaptability to various microhabitats.
